job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: Great benefits, benefits are inexpensive for a single person as well as a family. I have worked other health systems in the city where the benefits cost over double. The prescriptions are free, the co-pays are cheap for MD visits, and deductibles low. The pay is fair, good weekend differentials, management in my department good. They have decent tuition reimbursement and some student loan repayment programs. I enjoy working for UH. Many opportunities in the system for change too if you are at that point.
cons: I have no cons for the system.

cons: - poor access to appointments within the system - pay for residents is lower than average for the state, I’ve heard one of the lowest resident salaries in a Texas Health System - no benefits for residents, you take home more but nothing being saved for retirement, no options for investment. - management is tacky, when you work as moonlighter they take away your cafeteria discount, and even the ability to use payroll to pay for lunch (cause you don’t need a discount since you make extra money, right?) - management is insensitive to resident’s concerns and during meetings have been pretty brutal about the reality that we are replaceable. - physician recruitment staff with very poor communication.

They also degrade others (techs, RNs, lab, etc.) to get their way, like babies.

job_title: Surgical Technologist in San Antonio, TX
pros: Enjoyed working there, the doctors I worked with easy to get along with for the most part. The new OR is state of the art. If you are new to the field you should have a good length of time to train and get to specialize in a few areas.  For techs just learning the doctors ask for items and are a little slower since they are usually teaching. Insurance is really, really affordable and is the reason I took less pay to work there.
cons: Alot of different students and residents to work around and with, have to watch the sterile field closely. It can be a bit of a  slow pace. New residents and students and having to keep an eye on them and the sterile field closely. Not often but certain foreign med students seem to look down on nurses and techs,  didn't encounter this with local students.  Pay is lower than other hospitals and raises are strictly once of year if you get one from government.

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: You are always learning something new.

job_title: Medical Assistant in San Antonio, TX

review_title: Unit leadership young...cliques are a real problem
job_title: RN in San Antonio, TX
pros: Amazing medical faculty. Great working relationship between nurses, medical staff, and ancillary staff. Excellent learning experience. Fairly well staffed. Enough supplies.
cons: A real issue is that there is an abundance of very young nursing staff. Cliques run rampant and tend to cause issues within the units. Additionally, when leadership within the unit has worked with said clique and they're all buddies....needless to say, certain people get away with murder and others get screwed. They tend to play favorites such as over looking the nurse with 13 years of experience to allow their buddy, who only had a year or two worth of experience to train new staff members. Their decisions are inappropriate and based on who they like and who they go on vacation with....not what is in the best interest of the unit. I loved my job there but I couldn't tolerate the hostile work environment that was being created and condoned.  The director would make occasional, brief appearances but one of the PCCs actually ran the show....and she was running it into the ground. Very sad. It could've been an amazing unit

job_title: Data Analyst in San Antonio, TX
pros: Good benefits, fun work culture
cons: pay is minimal, management sucks

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: Company allows for growth and advancement
cons: Pay is a little lower than other companies. But health insurance makes up for it !

job_title: Transplant Coordinator in San Antonio, TX
pros: Time off, normal 40 hours for a salary position, great team
cons: No cons to say about my current job its amazing

job_title: Manager in San Antonio, TX
pros:
- Some of the kindest people you'll ever meet!
- Lots of new buildings means beautiful up-to-date workspaces.
- If you stay long enough, you'll be promoted eventually (regardless of your skill).
cons:
- System is very slow and full of red tape.
- Computers and computer systems are all about 10 years out of date.
- HR is painfully behind the curve and don't seem to understand most job descriptions or which skills are considered coveted in today's landscape.
- Benefits (aside from health benefits) generally are not great, and wages across the board are too low unless you are Executive Director level.
- Outdated system that makes it almost impossible to get more than 3% raise after your annual evaluation, no matter how hard you work.
- Age and years worked seem to really take precedence over talent, skill, personality, results, etc. Some of the most incompetent people I've ever met get promoted to the top just because they've been there for 15 years.

job_title: Staff RN in San Antonio, TX
pros: Shiny new main campus; is a teaching institution attached to UT health science center.
cons:
Federal law mandates private rooms= hellishly long hallways for nurses to traipse. The halls are each two football fields in length.

Annual revue not done until seven months after* it was due; received raise only on paper. Was promised raised would be retroactive from original review date, up & including those 7 months.  Both myself and super repeatedly called & emailed HR/Administration; all administration does is ignore, not*** pay out the raise...EVER.
That shiny new main campus costs about a billion $; of course they're not going to honor that lump sum raise, in any* way.

I've heard it dozens and dozens of times, seen it happen several, & had it finally happen to me--> HR/Administration will never, ever, ever* back up/ support their own employees when some ignorant visitor or patient makes even a totally baseless complaint.

job_title: Senior Phlebotomist in San Antonio, TX
pros: Great benefits. Customer service for benefits assistance is great and informative. You have to have a reference from your PCP but it's worth the hassle. Management worked with my inflexible schedule when I was a student and as soon as I graduated they hired me full time. PTO is great. Management has been wonderful at all locations I've worked for.
cons: I've noticed a bit of favoritism at some locations but for the most part if you get the job done you're valuable and appreciated. The training process is too short and not enough staff are qualified to train properly. If done by the book, it is a very informative trusting process and all areas are covered with on the job training. At my location we are understaffed and no time for proper training for someone with none to little experience.

review_title: Not a bad place to work, could be alot better with a few tweaks.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Antonio, TX
pros: Company has great benefits including health, PTO, good pay and opportunity to explore transfer to other departments to better your position.  Many really great caring people in all departments.
cons: To much favoritism, quid pro quo with supervisors & shift managers.  To many unqualified and lazy people. Lack of good training in some departments.  Some departments are not very organized.  Not very veteran friendly.

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in San Antonio, TX
pros: Well-organized management with appropriate incentives for high performances in every area of expertise in providing excellent care of patients with timely responses to doctors and surgeons need of laboratory results.  Benefits are excellent in health insurance, 457b retirement plan, vacation and sick leave benefits are tops, and excellent shift differentials.
cons: There are a few downsides:   hard working hours with a lean staff.  Plenty of overtime hours, but no overtime pay differential for professional salaried employees.  We understand this in order to keep expenses low as possible.  Otherwise, we still have the best paying hospital in town with the best healthcare system in town.  Really enjoyed my work here.  Recommend any who get the chance to work here.

review_title: I worked in patient registration and everyone was underpaid and overworked with no real training or managerial support.
job_title: Financial Registration Representative in San Antonio, TX
pros: You get great medical benefits including major medical, dental, vision, cancer, retirement, disablity, etc. The PTO accrual rate was 8 hours for every two weeks, which you could cash in or save up for extended leave (ie maternity).
cons: You never get any formal training or managerial support. You are forced to work overtime. Parking is deducted from your paycheck monthly and specific uniforms are required for all staff. Actually taking your earned PTO is difficult because managers do not want to approve any leave of absence. There are no leadership opportunities and the only people who thrive in the financial and registration side of University are the ones that ensure they are covered when any problems arise. The culture is horrendous and the turn over rate for employees far exceed anything you'd expect even from a teaching facility!

job_title: Staff III RN in San Antonio, TX
pros: Busy, teaching Level I where nursing has a voice with Docs. Care for the most needy and sickest patients for 22 counties
cons: After Magnet Journey was over and Magnet status achieved hospital management all changed and returned to how it was 25 years ago (when I started). Nurses are terrorized by Management, Current course is to run of the expensive senior nurses since they are paid max 38.11 hour but UHS has an excellent retirement 80/20 plan,. If you make it to working nearly 30 -35 years you will be costly. They are committed to building a new trauma tower they really cannot begin to afford.

review_title: Overall it has been good, but I believe that is due to the people that I have the pleasure of working with.
job_title: Laboratory Technician in San Antonio, TX
pros: Mainly the people, most are very friendly. The hours that are offered are also very nice. Since I am still in school during the mornings, I work second shift without any issues.
cons: Due to a hiring freeze there are some days that we are shorthanded in the lab. This same reason also means that its easily possible to rack up way more than 40 hours a week, especially if working weekends. That can be a con or a pro depending on how you see it.

job_title: Transfer Specialist in San Antonio, TX
pros: Working as a Transfer Specialist was a very rewarding experience. Where I learned about the process that a patient goes thru; since birth, all procedures thru life, admissions, rehab till death. Worked together with Social Worker and Case Management to supplied with all the patient need. Also translating from English to Spanish where requested.
cons: I planned to retired from University Hospital.  Unfortunately My Dad got sick and I took a leave of absence and later an early retirement.  I tried to apply again and has been very difficult.  My record was and a very good standing.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cleveland, OH
pros: Great benefits 403b retirement medical good work environment and I like the fact that you get paid time off for vacation, some companies don't offer you this package.
cons: The area that I work in has a very high turn over rate good workers resigning due to poor management in that department.

review_title: Disrespectful and rude to new nurses
job_title: Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: Training and experience are good
cons: I have experienced the most horrible degrading rudeness and disrespect from older nurses in this company.  I was a new nurse and I have never in my life met rude and inconsiderate people until now. Some are ok but lots of back stabbing and traitors. Management only believes what the older nurses say, new nurses appear to be lying or incompetent in their eyes. I feel degraded. Lots of drama and lies. People lying to each other. One time nurses made up stories just to get another nurse terminated. Other nurses acts like a boss and can dictate or make up stories manager would not even check what's really going on down their office. Nurses treats people under cheap government insurances poorly with disrespect! Cant take it anymore that's why I left!!!

job_title: Research Coordinator in San Antonio, TX
pros: Dirt cheap benefits package, a lot of educational benefits (reimbursement and pre-payment), county pays pretty good versus other institutions.
cons: Upper management is somewhat of a joke. Directors are constantly leaving and being replaced. Departments are being moved under new directors more often than they should. Co-workers or other employees that are in patient care are horrible. This hospital is rated #7 in the city for customer service, that says a lot about who it employs.

job_title: IT Manager in San Antonio, TX
pros: Good benefits and helps the low wage population.  County hospital is nice for county facility.
cons: There's are some great employees, but it seems that many of the good are leaving:(. Its sad because many of the folks that have new and fresh ideas are forced out.  No tolerance for positive change.

review_title: This is why you lose good employees
job_title: Mental Health in San Antonio, TX
pros: Uhs allowed me to transfer in 6 months after transfer if u do your job well. The training is decent.
cons: I find being an excellent employee, not enough dept heads selfish.  All about their paycheck. Resigning now I am now in danger every day of getting injured for lack of staffing. The census shld never be more important than your valued employees.

job_title: Senior Data Quality Analyst in San Antonio, TX
pros: The hospital itself is beautiful. It has lots of modern artwork, a progressive mission statement, and serves the community at large very well. Attempts at life-work balance.
cons: Archaic, non-transparent, inconsistent business practices create bad morale and immense frustration while administration works to catch up with the times. I️ will say that this may depend on the department, coming from a newer department.

job_title: Director in San Antonio, TX
pros: Great teamwork, lots of loyalty especially from 20-30 year employees. Health insurance still inexpensive, but have to wait a long time to see Primary Physician and specialists.
cons: Cutting benefits, not giving appropriate merit increases to save money.  Giving the Hospital President $150,000 raises every year and a bonus of $165,000.  Too many changes implemented simultaneously.  Employees have change fatigue.

job_title: Contracts Manager in San Antonio, TX
pros: Very few pros, Cafeteria on site is just about the only good thing the job. Other employees are very friendly.
cons:
No training given to perform role; this includes no system software program training, no program familiarization. Unclear expectations and expectations constantly change.
You can't time time off during the first 3 months or you'll be fired, not even for bereavement.
Your not a permanent employee until 3-6 months after your start date and if you are let go during this probationary period you won't get your PTO earnings paid out. (HR doesn't tell you this)

job_title: Clinical Operations in San Antonio, TX
pros: Largest medical center in San Antonio with new facility and nice ambiance within new facility.
cons: Rules are not used to make things better.  Rules seem to be used only to benefit those in power.  Leadership seems to be inconsistant and HR seems to support only the VPs or what they want.  We have a nice facility, but our EMR never seemed to work correctly. It was unavailable more than I'd ever seen at a hospital.  Some of the IT people seemed to make excuses that did not make sense.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in San Antonio, TX
pros: The great hours and working with the staff that were very team oriented guided by great leaders. I would recommend for anyone moving to the San Antonio area to apply there.
cons: There were no cons. I loved working there. I enjoyed learning new things and meeting new people everyday. Oh maybe one con that the hospital is expansive, but I see that as the benefit be be able to help people in need

job_title: Principal Trainer in San Antonio, TX
pros: Benefits package is only thing good about this place.
cons: Lead Trainer (Boss) has favorites within the group and she also has spies. She only listens to them and does not care about your side of things. When you are a new employee training is null. You get no training  to help you do your job. If you can not perform at 100% on your first day she will fire you. Promotions are only for their favorite.  I felt overwhelmed and cried and every one just looked at me and kept walking.

job_title: Pharmacist in San Antonio, TX
pros: great place to gain clinical  experience and knowledge. A level 1 trauma center is the best. It also has a large emphasis on teaching.
cons: managers do not communicate well with each other or take employee concerns seriously. they ask you to let them know if you have any concerns and act like your best friend, it is best to keep quiet no matter what if you want to keep your job

review_title: Excellent company to work for, lots of potential to grow in the medical field
job_title: Operations Manager in San Antonio, TX
pros: Excellent teaching hospital for those who are new to the medical field.  Excellent intern programs for students in nursing school
cons: You have to pay a monthly fee for parking and the cost of uniforms and the UHS emblem can get pretty expensive.

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros:
Great coworkers
Diverse patient population 
Up to date equipment 
Decent  salary

Access to university facilities 
Accurate employee time card system

cons:

job_title: Manager in San Antonio, TX
pros: The organization truly cares for their patients and staff. Nursing staff are fantastic advocates for their patients.
cons: Managerial roles are very difficult due to the culture of HR.

review_title: This company need a better management , HR doesn't do anything! for the supply department
job_title: Supply in San Antonio, TX
pros: make many friends, and people from other department are nicer that the departments at the supply depart.
cons: they pay is so low!!!!, and the raises are .05 cents per year...its like a drama world!!!

job_title: Manager in San Antonio, TX
pros: Some areas are better than others. Somewhat flexible schedule. I have respect for the new CMIO and CNO.
cons: Silos everywhere. Can be political.  Benefits not that great, and PTO not great. Hard to get rid of bad employees. Not willing to listen to new ideas.

job_title: ROI Specialist in San Antonio, TX
pros: Assisting client was very rewarding.
cons: A lot of negativity from UHS employees, who offer you to help you out and then they will go up to management to complain about you taking their time. Staff do whatever they want and clock in and instead of starting to work they take off to the cafeteria. They so many "breaks" and no one says anything. No wonder why they are so behind with the workload!

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in San Antonio, TX
pros:
Cheap but good benefits
Interesting cases - reference lab to other hospitals allowing you to see a lot of different tests
cons:
Three months have passed and still no Manager has been hired
Suddenly cut all over time
Three supervisors have left in the last 5 months
Decisions are being made from upper management without regard to how it effects lab personel

job_title: Clerical in San Antonio, TX
pros: Good benefits, but take half of leave when you leave or are laid off.
cons: Pay extremely low, dont value employees

job_title: Physician in San Antonio, TX
pros: Academic and community environment with a strive to provide the best care for patient regardless of ability to pay.
cons: Upper management does not share their plan or vision for the future. Costly decisions are made by people who do not have expertise

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Antonio, TX
pros: Good health insurance and great place to learn.  Pay was competitive.
cons:
No work life balance. I received phone calls from leadership at all hours of the day and on weekends.  

CEO is no longer there but he was very corrupt.

review_title: Left on good terms and they wouldn't rehire me
job_title: Supervisor in Converse, TX
pros: Great growth potential, great and affordable health insurance
cons: Low pay, clickish environment, a lot of backstabbing and retaliatory treatment, won't rehire you if you're not the right color or know the right people

job_title: EC Pct in San Antonio, TX
pros: The benefits are good, pay is average.  You get to work with a variety of people from different backgrounds, there is always overtime available.
cons: Really,if you enjoy working in an extremely fast-paced ER, then there aren't many cons.  Compared to other companies I have worked for, the training is very short.

review_title: Power driven people failure in all management every level.
job_title: Plant Operator in San Antonio, TX
pros: Hospital" Barely"  maybe below that
cons: In maintenance: people are power driven and unskilled I have seen good strong people get denied a job because of the color of there skin.  I quote here  "if you are not Mexican you are working here" !!!

job_title: Systems Administrator in Cibolo, TX
pros: Latest medical tech - surgery robots
cons: Managers who have held the same role for 20 years....needs a shakeup to prevent the good ol boy network sinking the ship.....Could be world class if management would lead instead of worrying about looking good to others

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: There are always hours to pick up at the hospital
